title: 3 Easy Ways to Organize iPhone Apps in Alphabetical Order

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . This is the grey cog icon. Make sure to update your iPhone . [2] X Research source This method will reset all default apps to their default locations and alphabetize all third-party apps. This will also erase any existing app folders on your home screen. If you don't want to lose unique folders, try manually organizing the apps instead.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . This can be towards the middle of Settings . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Transfer or Reset iPhone.
steps.content: Tap Transfer or Reset iPhone . You can find this towards the bottom, above Shut Down . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Reset.
steps.content: Tap Reset . A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Reset Home Screen Layout.
steps.content: Tap Reset Home Screen Layout . This will reset your Home screen to its default settings with default apps. All third-party apps you have installed will be organized alphabetically. [5] X Research source If you're looking for new ways to organize your iPhone, consider an aesthetic Home screen layout .

steps.title: Tap and hold an app on your Home screen.
steps.content: Tap and hold an app on your Home screen. If you added apps to your Home screen, you can easily organize them how you want. [6] X Research source Use this method to manually alphabetize your Home screen apps.

steps.title: Drag the app to a new location.
steps.content: Drag the app to a new location. Doing so will put your Home screen in Edit mode, and the apps will shake. [7] X Research source You can also long-press an app and tap Edit Home Screen .

steps.title: Release the app.
steps.content: Release the app. This will place the app in the designated position.

steps.title: Repeat for all remaining apps.
steps.content: Repeat for all remaining apps. Use steps 1 to 3 to manually place the apps in alphabetical order.

steps.title: Click Done when finished.
steps.content: Click Done when finished. This will exit Edit mode. Alternatively, click anywhere on the Home screen to exit Edit mode.

steps.title: Swipe left on your Home screen.
steps.content: Swipe left on your Home screen. If you have more than one page for your Home screen, continue to swipe until you see the App Library . [8] X Research source The App Library contains a list of pre-alphabetized apps.

steps.title: Click the search bar at the top.
steps.content: Click the search bar at the top. Your apps will be displayed in alphabetical order. [9] X Research source Scroll up and down to view the apps, or use the letters listed on the right side to navigate.
